bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 165, Number 28 (Wednesday, February 13, 2019)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. RYAN:H.R. 1211.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8: To make all Laws which shall benecessary and proper for carrying into Execution theforegoing Powers, and all other Powers vested by thisConstitution in the Government of the United States, or inany Department or Officer thereof.[Page H1585]

item.title: John D. Dingell, Jr. Conservation, Management, and Recreation Act
A bill to amend the Ohio & Erie National Heritage Canalway Act of 1996 to modify the funding limitation.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

summary.text: This bill repeals the limitation on the total amount that may be appropriated for the Ohio & Erie National Heritage Canalway.

bill.title: To amend the Ohio & Erie Canal National Heritage Canalway Act of 1996 to repeal the funding limitation.

item.title: To amend the Ohio & Erie Canal National Heritage Canalway Act of 1996 to repeal the funding limitation.
To amend the Ohio & Erie Canal National Heritage Canalway Act of 1996 to repeal the funding limitation.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
